This PR was opened by the [Changesets release](https://github.com/changesets/action) GitHub action. When you're ready to do a release, you can merge this and the packages will be published to npm automatically. If you're not ready to do a release yet, that's fine, whenever you add more changesets to main, this PR will be updated.

- Update some missed `mipsVersion` literals pointing to the old version
- Add some more version helpers to further centralize current mips v

prs.title: op-supervisor: Return NotFound for missing cross-safe data
prs.truncated_body:
This ensures that `ethereum.NotFound` error percolates through the supervisor RPC so that it's observed by the op-challenger. When no super root exists at timestamp, we use `ethereum.NotFound` to indicate this, and this is used by the op-challenger to dispute using the `InvalidTransition` super root.


## Context on op-challenger disputes

[This](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/

commits.message: op-supervisor: Return NotFound for missing cross-safe data

prs.title: op-supervisor: improve sync logic
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

This fixes a bunch of bad sync situations that we identified while discussing RC Alpha:
- When searching for a sync starting point, use the anchor-point as the start, not literally block-0, to be upgrade-compatible
- When resetting-if-inconsistent, do not go back to the latest seen block, always prefer the local-safe chain if it is further along.
- When bisecting, bisect agai

prs.title: feat: standardize upgradeable L1 contracts
prs.truncated_body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**
Standardizes all L1 Proxy contracts to use the following pattern:
- `initialize` and `upgrade` are always `onlyProxyAdmin`
- All contracts are `ReinitializableBase` and `ProxyAdminOwnedBase`

prs.title: op-deployer: support MIPS64 contract verification
prs.truncated_body: The default MIPS contract that gets deployed is now `MIPS64` so we need to point to that forge-artifact during contract verification. The name of the contract in our go structs is still `mips` or `mipsSingleton` so this pr adds an exception that maps `Mips` --> `MIPS64.sol/MIPS64.json`

commits.message:
fix: ensure active fps have signing info after proposal (#860)

It is possible that some inactive fps become active after executing the
finality resumption proposal. However, current implementation does not
initiate signing info for those fps, which would cause panicking when
handling liveness.

This PR fixed the issue by ensuring every active finality provider has
signing info in the finality resumption proposal.

---------

Co-authored-by: RafilxTenfen <rafaeltenfen.rt@gmail.com>

const value = useResponsiveValue([100, 200, null, 500])

prs.title: flamenco, gossip: two-tiered value table
prs.truncated_body:
We now have two data structures that manage our Gossip value table

1. value_metas: holds the metadata (hash + wallclock) of a processed value. Used in dedup + bloom filter construction. 

2. values: vector that holds the encoded form of the processed value. Used in gossip push + pull resp loops. The loops are now linear scans.

A cleanup policy that exploits this tiered value table will all

commits.message: flamenco, gossip: two-tiered value table for fast iteration in push and pullresp loops

flamenco, gossip: use vector as push queue; order-preserving cleanup;
convenience functions

prs.title: flamenco: Add BitVector type
prs.truncated_body:
Fixes Types Fuzzer mismatch by adding support for a `BitVector` member type in `gen_stubs.py` and `gen_fuzz.py`. We need a BitVector type because there is an invariant check that the length of the bitvector matches the length of the number of bits.

Verified that this fixes the types fuzzer mismatch locally in solfuzz.

prs.title: Remove x86intrin.h dependency from fd_util.h
prs.truncated_body:
Changes code so that including `fd_util.h` no longer includes `<x86intrin.h>` and friends.

The x86 intrinsics are about 70k lines of headers, which makes up the majority of compile-time for small compile units.

`make -j lib CC=gcc-14`:
Before: 0m28.815s
After: 0m26.495s

`make -j lib=CC=clang`:
Before: 0m21.672s
After: 0m19.811s

prs.title: Add Confidential Transfers package
prs.truncated_body:
We want to move the confidential transfers library into sei-js. 
This new library will allow users to
- Interact with the Confidential Transfers module using ethers
- Interacting with the Confidential Transfers module using viem
- Create raw payloads to be used in the Confidential Transfers module

- Fixed name of package for confidential transfers

Remove ct install state from git repository

prs.title: chore(component-library): extract app shell from insights hub
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

This PR makes a few related changes:

- Extract the app shell from insights hub to component library
- Merge `next-root`, `app-logger`, and `fonts` into the component library (the separation here didn't end up to be as clean as I'd originally hoped)
- Fix storybook and handle dark/light mode and primary/secondary backgrounds more correctly

## Rationale

I have a few new apps

commits.message:
chore(component-library): extract app shell from insights hub

This PR makes a few related changes:

- Extract the app shell from insights hub to component library
- Merge `next-root`, `app-logger`, and `fonts` into the component library (the
  separation here didn't end up to be as clean as I'd originally hoped)
- Fix storybook and handle dark/light mode and primary/secondary backgrounds
  more correctly

prs.title: fix(fortuna): remove wss related code
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

As the title

## Rationale

I'm trying to refactor the codebase and make the keeper functions more manageable. This was a low-hanging fruit.
We are not using websockets in any of the chains and I'm not sure if we can do it through erpc.

## How has this been tested?

- [ ] Current tests cover my changes
- [ ] Added new tests
- [x] Manually tested the code

prs.title: feat(entropy): Split out V2 interface into separate file.
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

Split out the V2 functionality into a separate file. The intention is that developers can interact exclusively with the IEntropyV2 interface. This interface hides internal methods for providers etc that users don't need to know about. Meanwhile, we retain the IEntropy interface (which has the old functions + provider functions + inherits the V2 functions) as the full interface the co

commits.message:
Refactor hero section animations with dynamic SVG motion and responsive styling

- Implemented dynamic SVG animation generation with `generateMotionTiming` utility
- Created modular animation components for hero section backgrounds
- Updated HeroContent component with new responsive animation approach
- Enhanced CSS modules with improved media query breakpoints and positioning
- Added utility function to generate randomized, natural motion animations

Add dynamic SVG background animations to ColorCards component

- Implemented responsive CurvedPathAnimation SVG component
- Added dynamic width and height tracking for grid layout
- Integrated animated SVG backgrounds with motion effects
- Enhanced ColorCards component with client-side rendering and responsive design

Modify hero section SVG animations with consistent directions

- Simplified animation path generation for SquareAnimation, RectangleAnimation, and CornerAnimation
- Increased pause duration from 0.2 to 0.3 seconds for smoother transitions

Refine hero section layout and search input with minor UI adjustments

- Updated search input placeholder and removed optional caption
- Adjusted header and hero section margins and padding
- Fine-tuned color card and hero content positioning
- Simplified SearchInput component props

Fix search input validation state management

- Added `setIsBoxInvalid(false)` to reset box validation state when suggestions are shown
- Ensures consistent validation behavior in SearchInput component

Extract animated SVG components to dedicated AnimatedShapes module

- Moved SquareAnimation, RectangleAnimation, and CornerAnimation from HeroContent to new AnimatedShapes.tsx
- Simplified component imports in HeroContent
- Added optional noBackground prop to support more flexible animation rendering
- Preserved existing animation logic and motion generation
Remove unused CSS animations and commented code in HeroContent module

Refactor HeroContent components with new animation positioning and responsive styles

- Updated HeroContent CSS modules for developers and governance pages
- Replaced legacy animation approach with new RectangleAnimation and CornerAnimation components
- Simplified positioning using CSS transforms and custom properties
- Enhanced responsive design with improved media query breakpoints
- Removed deprecated animation and image loading techniques

Refactor ColorCards component with path animation and modular design

- Split ColorCards into base ColorCards and ColorCardsWithPath components
- Added wrapper class for vertical spacing between cards
- Improved component modularity and reusability
- Maintained existing animation and styling logic

Enhance SearchInput styling with subtle transitions and placeholder improvements

- Added smooth transition effect to input field
- Updated placeholder color and opacity for better visual hierarchy
- Simplified input border styling when placeholder is shown
- Added color to search icon for improved visibility
Remove commented-out code and unused animations from HeroContent component

prs.title: Bump version to 22.7.0

### What
Bump version to 22.7.0, creating release branch.

### Why
Triggered by @fnando in https://github.com/stellar/stellar-cli/actions/runs/14786223727.

### What is next

See the release instructions for a full rundown on the release process:
https://github.com/stellar/actions/blob/main/README-rust-release.md

Commit any changes to the `release/v22.7.0` branch that are needed in this release.

prs.title: fix: add compound primary key to `rotate_keys_transactions` table
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

This was supposed to be done in https://github.com/stacks-sbtc/sbtc/pull/1599, but was missed. The bug would make possible for us to drop key rotation events when they get replayed following a fork.

## Changes

* Update the primary key of the `rotate_keys_transactions` table to be a compound primary key on the `txid` and `block_hash` table.

## Testing Information

This

commits.message:
Reduce the verbosity of state tree load failure to debug in `StateTree`

This code path is being hit much more often now that F3 is enabled. To
reduce noise in logs change the log level for this error to DEBUG.

prs.title: go/consensus/api: Remove services backend
prs.truncated_body: Halt hooks are only used by full nodes and can be specific to the backend implementation. To simplify the service backend interface, halt hooks were moved to full node. They can be moved back later if needed.

commits.message:
go/consensus/cometbft: Move halt hooks to CometBFT backend

Halt hooks are only used by full nodes and can be specific to the backend
implementation. To simplify the service backend interface, halt hooks were
moved to full node. They can be moved back later if needed.

prs.title: refactor: use the built-in max/min to simplify the code
prs.truncated_body: In Go 1.21, the standard library includes built-in [max/min](https://pkg.go.dev/builtin@go1.21.0#max) function, which can greatly simplify the code.

commits.message:
refactor: use the built-in max/min to simplify the code

- Use the correct `ctx` when calling on subscribe hooks.

prs.title: Add test for proposervm BuildBlock after bootstrapping
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

1. https://github.com/ava-labs/avalanchego/blob/master/vms/proposervm/scheduler/scheduler.go#L52. The initial build block time is specified when starting the scheduler.
2. https://github.com/ava-labs/avalanchego/blob/master/vms/proposervm/vm.go#L181. The initial build block time is just passed in as `time.Now()` - so the scheduler is initialized to allow `BuildBloc

prs.title: Remove RequestBuildBlock on P-Chain Mempool
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

This function doesn't seem to belong on the mempool type because consensus is responsible for building the block. I think another alternative would be to put `RequestBuildBlock` onto a static function somewhere, but I'm not sure where it would live (probably not the mempool package) + I don't think the cost of duplicate code is bad here.

## How this works

Remo

commits.message:
remove request build block function on mempool type

Signed-off-by: Joshua Kim <20001595+joshua-kim@users.noreply.github.com>

prs.title: chore(tests): migrate to vitest
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:
This PR migrates our SDK test suite from Mocha and Chai to [Vitest](https://vitest.dev/) to improve performance, developer experience, and maintainability.

### Changes:
- Replaced Mocha and Chai with Vitest
- Maintained test behavior parity with minimal changes
- Ensured CI and test coverage remain intact
- Removed Mocha, Chai, related dependencies and unused scripts

**

commits.message:
chore(tests) initial vitest setup

Below changes are applied for the sdk and cryptography package
Setup node env tests
Setup browser env tests
Setup node environment integration tests
Adapted mocha used hooks to relevant vitest ones
Setup eslint-vitest-plugin
Disable some rules for using mocha assertions in vitest tests as
these assertions need to be adapted incrementaly as there are many.
Create a separate tsconfig for typesafety in the tests.

Signed-off-by: venilinvasilev <venilin.vasilev@gmail.com>

chore(tests): setup codecov, update taskfiles

Setup tsconfigs and eslint configs for tests
Remove unnecessary files

Signed-off-by: venilinvasilev <venilin.vasilev@gmail.com>

chore(tests): extend unit test timeout

Signed-off-by: venilinvasilev <venilin.vasilev@gmail.com>

chore(tests): remove chai import

Signed-off-by: venilinvasilev <venilin.vasilev@gmail.com>

ci(build): add cryptography browser tests

Change unit test step for hashgraph/sdk to browser unit test
as node unit tests are ran in the next codecov step and there is no point
to run them twice

Signed-off-by: dependabot[bot] <support@github.com>
feat: Add name resolution endpoint for CNS and L1 domains
feat: Modify ENS mapping to append .clk.eth suffix
feat: Add HttpError custom error class for HTTP status handling and modular validation for firebase
feat: Implement L2 name registration and message generation endpoints with enhanced validation
feat: added error handler for new endpoints
feat: Add buildTypedData function to generate hash of typed messages

Implement text records in ClickNameService and associated tests

* Add mapping for text records in ClickNameService.
* Implement functions to set and get text records.
* Emit events when setting text records.
* Add tests to verify the functionality of text records, including authorization and expiration.

* Added AbiCoder import in helpers.ts.
* Introduced new constants for commit ABI and stored batch in interfaces.ts.
* Improved parseCommitTransaction function to handle transaction errors not found.
* Added validations for the “sender” parameter in the /storageProof path in index.ts.
* Removed unnecessary whitespace in several functions.
Updated .gitignore file to include sa.json. Added additional resources section in README.md with links to L1 contracts and ZK stack addresses. Updated .dockerignore to reflect change in .gitignore.
ClickResolver: rename constants, add storage slots for addresses/text, improve resolution logic and storage proof verification
Improve decoding and storage proof handling in "/storageProof": add safeUtf8Decode, enhance long string support, update imports and error handling
Add name deletion handling to ClickNameService: emit NameDeleted event and clean up text records on burn
Add text record support to IClickNameService: implement setTextRecord and getTextRecord with docs

Restore ClickNameService and IClickNameService. The setTextRecord and getTextRecord functions and related events and mappings are removed. Instead a new INameService contract is introduced and NameService is implemented, which includes name registration and expiration management functionality.

Add name service deployment and unit tests. Created deploy_name_service.dp.ts file to handle NameService contract deployment and added NameService.t.sol file for tests that verify registration and text record management, including name authorization and expiration cases.

Refactor signature validation and typed data construction in helpers.ts. The verifyMessage function is replaced by verifyTypedData and the validateSignature signature is updated to accept typedData. Modified buildTypedData to include a domain object and specific types. In addition, the data handling in index.ts is adjusted to reflect these changes, including additional validations for email.

deploy_nodl_name_service.dp.ts to handle the implementation of the NameService contract. Added logic for contract verification and introduced a control variable for deployment. Error handling during contract verification is improved.

Refactored the naming service: renamed variables and functions to improve clarity and consistency. Removed the CLICK_NAME_SERVICE_INTERFACE dependency, replacing it with NAME_SERVICE_INTERFACE. Domain name validations were adjusted and a new function buildZyfiRegisterRequest was implemented to simplify the creation of registration requests. In addition, the addresses of name service contracts in setup.ts were updated.
Update the registration logic in index.ts to break the name into two parts: name and subdomain. Modifies the buildZyfiRegisterRequest function to accept name and subdomain as parameters

Implemented new paths for name service in names.ts. Added endpoints to register names, set text records and resolve names. Improved the buildTypedData function to accept custom types and implemented the buildZyfiSetTextRecordRequest function. Additional validations are performed for input data and error handling logic is adjusted.

Added ENS text record handling in the name service. Implemented handleENSTextRecord function to handle TextRecordSet events, and updated schema and ABI files to include new types and related events. Modifications were made to the mapping files to integrate text record logic and improved the data structure in the project.

Updates the environment configuration and docker-compose file to include new contract addresses. CLICK_NS_ADDR and NODLE_NS_ADDR variables are added to .env.example and used in docker-compose.yml. In addition, the testnet-complete.ts file is modified to reflect the new contract addresses and the validation in ens.ts is adjusted to verify the existence of the new environment variables.

Updated the validation of contract addresses in ens.ts. Defined CLICK_NS_ADDR and NODLE_NS_ADDR constants with default values and adjusted the verification logic to use these constants instead of environment variables directly.
chore:OpenJDK 24 LTS for api and indexer.
